Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery closed vase, probably oinochoe; orientation uncertain. Two friezes, stopt maeander and lotus and bud, separated by bands with superimposed red and white lines.
Dimensions: Height: 14 centimetres (according to Venit - seems wrong)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 9, no. 21a pl. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.618)
